availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Milton Clark (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer. Christian County, Kentucky, native. Married to Malinda Burks Clark in Polk County, Missouri, on March 18, 1841. Father of Amanda M. Clark, Nancy Pernecy Clark, Maranda E. Clark, and Joseph L. Clark. Member of the Democratic Party. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 475B-476A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 564.
Missouri Marriage Records, 1805-2002, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, Polk County Marriages, 1836-1889, p. 115.
"Joe Clark Dead," The Owensboro Messenger (KY), October 1, 1896, Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/clip/97938160.
William Henry Perrin, editor, County of Christian, Vol. II, Historical and Biographical, (Chicago: F. A. Battery Pub. Co., 1884), 357-58.
